frontmatter.title: GlueViz for Heterogeneous data
frontmatter.description: An open-sourced Python library with graphical user interace. Built on top of well known packages such as Numpy, Scipy, and Matplotlib.

frontmatter.title: Assess FAIRness of datasets in ORDA
frontmatter.description: This visualisation present the FAIRness assessment results for datasets in Online Research Data (University's data repository). The assessment was made using the F-UJI web service.

frontmatter.title: Why Garden? Attitudes and the perceived health benefits of home gardening
frontmatter.description: An interactive shiny app visualising summary statistics from (Chalmin-Pui et al. 2021).

frontmatter.title: Introducing the new visualisation page
frontmatter.description: We are excited to announce the new visualisation page in Dataviz.Shef!

frontmatter.title: Overfishing and habitat loss drive range contraction of iconic marine fishes to near extinction
frontmatter.description: Researchers develop a space-for-time approach to track the spatial contraction and drivers of decline of sawfishes. These iconic and endangered shark-like rays were once found in warm, coastal waters of 90 nations and are now presumed extinct in more than half (n = 46). Researchers also predict that sawfishes are gone from at least nine additional nations.

frontmatter.title: Applications of ParaView
frontmatter.description: ParaView

frontmatter.title: Improved rice cooking approach to maximise arsenic removal while preserving nutrient elements
frontmatter.description: The parboiled and absorbed (PBA) method removed 54% & 73% inorganic arsenic (iAs) from brown & white rice. The PBA method raised margin of exposure (MOE) by 3.7 and 2.2 times for white and brown rice, respectively. Read the paper for this method's graphical abstract and step by step guide.
category: School Of Health And Related Research

frontmatter.title: Alcohol pricing policies are estimated to be more effective at reducing consumption and harm for men than women
frontmatter.description:
A sunburst visualisation that shows modelled effects of tax and minimum unit pricing (MUP) policies on Consumption (units per year), Expenditure (annual £ spent), and Hospitalisations (at full effect).
You can choose to see the modelled effects in percentage change (default choice, express the change in percentage) or absolute change (real value).
category: School Of Health And Related Research

frontmatter.title: Statistical Testing
frontmatter.description: Statistical Modeling Part 3 - Regression models

frontmatter.title: Leading risk factors for disability-adjusted life years in different SDI countries
frontmatter.description: A simple visualisation that shows leading risk factors for number of years lost due to overall disease burden, in countries with different Socio-Demographic Indexes.
category: School Of Health And Related Research

frontmatter.title: Which statistical test to use for two variables?
frontmatter.description: An interative tool based on the flowchart made by Jean Russell to help you determine which statistical test to use for two variables. This tool is a part of the statistical modelling learning path.

frontmatter.title: Millions of UK residents struggle to access food
frontmatter.description: A new study from the University of Sheffield has revealed the areas in the UK where residents most struggle to afford or access food. For the first time researchers were able to identify food insecurity at local authority scale across three categories, from those experiencing hunger, to those just one emergency away from going without food.

frontmatter.title: Contribute visualisation
frontmatter.description: (UPDATED on 21 Jul 2021) In this document you will find out more about how to contribute visualisation to this website.

frontmatter.title: Low vaccination rate in London
frontmatter.description: Covid cases rates are rising in London where vaccine coverage in the over 50s is low. What this might mean for the capital as cases rise and restrictions are relaxed on 19th July 2021.
category: School Of Health And Related Research

frontmatter.title: People turned to sweets, chocolate and salty snacks during the Covid-19 lockdowns in the UK and Australia
frontmatter.description: A new study led by the University of Sheffield suggests that treats, such as sweets, chocolate and salty treats, increased for some people during Covid-19 lockdowns. People with low control over their cravings were most at risk of increasing their snack intake during the lockdown. Researchers warn about weight and health related issues for at-risk adults due to the impact of lockdowns on our eating behaviours.

frontmatter.title: Covid plot
frontmatter.description: Plots and analysis relating to the pandemic.
category: School Of Health And Related Research

frontmatter.title: Which Politicians Receive Abuse During 2019 Election Campaign
frontmatter.description: A shiny app built around the spreadsheets contain aggregate statistics for abusive language found in tweets to UK politicians in 2019.

frontmatter.title: Visualising Cultural Heritage Data
frontmatter.description: Data visualisation for cultural heritage collections workshop presented by Dr Olivia Vane of The British Library on N8 CIR Training.

frontmatter.title: The long shadow of the pandemic
frontmatter.description: Confirmed COVID-19 mortality rates per MSOA represented as height.
category: School Of Health And Related Research

frontmatter.title: Workplace conflict costs employers £28 billion a year
frontmatter.description: New analysis published today (11 May 2021) estimates workplace conflict costs UK employers £28.5 billion every year - just over £1,000 on average for every employee.

frontmatter.title: University of Sheffield researchers to help bring Green Industrial Revolution
frontmatter.description: Researchers from the University of Sheffield Energy Institute are set to work with the Drax power station to generate hydrogen and sustainable aviation fuels from biomass gasification and carbon capture as part of a £20m UKRI-funded project.

frontmatter.title: Statistical Modeling
frontmatter.description: A statistical model is a mathematical model used to describe the relationship between different variables. It contains a set of assumptions about the sample data and usually represent the data generation process in a idealised form.

frontmatter.title: Non-random sampling
frontmatter.description: Subjective methods of extracting samples based on the researcher's opinions, experience, or relevant knowledge.

frontmatter.title: Probability Distributions
frontmatter.description: Statistical Modeling Part 1 - In this chapter we will be exploring probability distributions by variable types.

frontmatter.title: More random sampling methods
frontmatter.description: Stratified, systematic, and cluster sampling methods.

frontmatter.description: Statistical Modeling Part 2 - What is sampling? Sampling from a distribution? How to describe a sample?

frontmatter.description: The title says it all! Some snippets of advice for making our charts more fit for purpose.

frontmatter.title: Data visualisation in c++ with computational models
frontmatter.description: In this blog post I'm going to talk about data visualisation - making graphs - within c++ programs. I'll describe why you might want to do this and I'll try to justify why I've spent a sizeable part of my time over the last couple of years developing graphing code in c++, rather than using Python or R like everyone else!

frontmatter.description: Part 2 | Exploring packages in R using data collected as part of the EU funded 'Collaborative research and development of green roof system technology' project.

frontmatter.description: Part 1 | Exploring packages in R using data collected as part of the EU funded 'Collaborative research and development of green roof system technology' project.

frontmatter.title: Moving from Excel to R
frontmatter.description: There are a lot of things to learn when you make a transition from Excel to R, especially if you haven't touched programming languages before, everything can be overwhelming and frustrating. Hopefully this article will help you make a smooth transition.

frontmatter.title: Microsoft Excel Best Practices
frontmatter.description: What steps could we take to make better data visualisations with excel?

frontmatter.title: Data Visualization’s Social Role
frontmatter.description: Data visualizations have effects. If we don’t stop to think about data visualizations' social role and the people who engage with them, they may not have the impact that their producers intend.

frontmatter.title: With great power comes great responsibility - challenges in visualising data
frontmatter.description: As researchers and practitioners we also need to be conscious of the wider social impact which can arise from visualising data and consider how to do so responsibly.

frontmatter.title: D3.js for data visualisation
frontmatter.description: A simple introduction to D3.js (Data-Driven Documents) - a powerful Javascript Library for creating interactive data visualisation in web browers by manipulating Document Object Model (DOM).

frontmatter.title: Visualising GM data with a Shiny dashboard
frontmatter.description: A shiny dashboard that lets users explore the relationship between socio-cultural and GM-attitudinal measures described in Mallinson et.al. (2018) - Why rational argument fails the genetic modification (GM) debate.

frontmatter.description: A selection of visualisation templates for you to build a visualisation more quickly.

frontmatter.description: It is exciting to see your beautiful dash app running locally, but it would be even more interesting if  others can interact it over the web too!

frontmatter.description: Explore data visualisations through definitions, examples, videos, and relevant resources.

frontmatter.title: Hosting Jupyter Notebook
frontmatter.description: The Jupyter Notebook has become a very popluar web application for sharing and creating documents  that contain live code, equations, visualisations and narrative text. This article put together a  number of user-friendly pathways for running live, interactive Jupyter notebooks on the web, and  documentation on how to use it.

frontmatter.title: Interactive Notebook with Jupyter Widgets
frontmatter.description: Based on the post - 'Plots wth Python', using IPython's widgets for exploring code and UK accidents dataset interactively.

frontmatter.title: Dash: Layout and interactive
frontmatter.description: Dash apps are built with two parts - 'layout' and 'interactive'. To help us understand these two parts, let's build a dash app step by step and explore  useful documentations around them.

frontmatter.title: Simple data visualisations have become key to communicating about the COVID-19 pandemic, but we know little about their impact.
frontmatter.description: Helen Kennedy is Professor of Digital Society at the University of Sheffield. Her research traverses digital landscapes. She is especially interested in the datafication of everyday life.

frontmatter.title: Visualising data on the web with Python and Dash
frontmatter.description: Dash is a user interface library for creating analytical web applications. Those who use Python for data analysis, data exploration, visualization, modelling, instrument control, and reporting will find immediate use for Dash.

frontmatter.title: Visualising high risk areas for Covid-19 mortality
frontmatter.description: Colin Angus recently demonstrated various visualisations that he had created for Covid-19 mortality on Twitter. Here he elaborates on his approach to this work.

frontmatter.description: Statistics is the science of the collection, analysis, interpretation and presentation of data. Descriptive statistics helps us to summarise and describe data.

frontmatter.description: With so many charts to choose from, how do we know which type will present our data the most effectively?

frontmatter.description: What, Why, How, Where. Learn more by go through three different learning paths  which includes contents on explore data visualisations, tutorials and guides on creating data visualisation, and adopt reproducible workflow.

frontmatter.description: (UPDATED on 21 Apr 2021) This article will guide you to setup a development environment, relevant steps for produce a blog post, and introduce you to useful syntax for styling the blog post and adding resources such as images, videos, and codes.

frontmatter.title: Urban Observatories hackathon
frontmatter.description: The University of Sheffield hosted a three-day hackathon aimed to begin tackling the complex challenges involved in coordinating analytics using data from urban observatories across the UK.
